net.floodlightcontroller.dhcpserver

Class DHCPPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.floodlightcontroller.dhcpserver.DHCPPool

  • public class DHCPPool
extends java.lang.Object
    The class representing a DHCP Pool. This class is essentially a list of DHCPBinding objects containing IP, MAC, and lease status information.
    Author:
    Ryan Izard (rizard@g.clemson.edu)

    • Constructor Detail

      • DHCPPool

        public DHCPPool(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.IPv4Address startingIPv4Address,
                int size)
        Constructor for a DHCPPool of DHCPBinding's. Each DHCPBinding object is initialized with a null MAC address and the lease is set to inactive (i.e. false).
        Parameters:
        {@code - byte[]} startingIPv4Address: The lowest IP address to lease.
        {@code - integer} size: (startingIPv4Address + size) is the highest IP address to lease.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • setDHCPbinding

        public void setDHCPbinding(DHCPBinding binding,
                           org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.MacAddress mac,
                           int time)
        Assigns a MAC address to the IP address of the DHCPBinding object in the DHCPPool object. This method also sets the lease to active (i.e. true) when the assignment is made.
        Parameters:
        {@code - DHCPBinding} binding: The DHCPBinding object in which to set the MAC
        {@code - byte[]} mac: The MAC address to set in the DHCPBinding object
        {@code - long}: The time in seconds for which the lease will be valid

      • removeIPv4FromDHCPPool

        public void removeIPv4FromDHCPPool(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.IPv4Address ip)
        Completely removes the DHCPBinding object with IP address byte[] ip from the DHCPPool
        Parameters:
        {@code - byte[]} ip: The IP address to remove from the pool. This address will not be available for lease after removal.

      • addIPv4ToDHCPPool

        public DHCPBinding addIPv4ToDHCPPool(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.IPv4Address ip)
        Adds an IP address to the DHCPPool if the address is not already present. If present, nothing is added to the DHCPPool.
        Parameters:
        {@code - byte[]} ip: The IP address to attempt to add to the DHCPPool
        Returns:
        DHCPBinding: Reference to the DHCPBinding object if successful, null if unsuccessful

      • hasAvailableAddresses

        public boolean hasAvailableAddresses()
        Determines if there are available leases in this DHCPPool.
        Returns:
        boolean: true if there are addresses available, false if the DHCPPool is full

      • getAnyAvailableLease

        public DHCPBinding getAnyAvailableLease(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.MacAddress mac)
        Returns an available address (DHCPBinding) for lease. If this MAC is configured for a static/fixed IP, that DHCPBinding will be returned. If this MAC has had a lease before and that same lease is available, that DHCPBinding will be returned. If not, then an attempt to return an address that has not been active before will be made. If there are no addresses that have not been used, then the lowest currently inactive address will be returned. If all addresses are being used, then null will be returned.
        Parameters:
        {@code - byte[]): MAC address of the device requesting the lease
        Returns:
        DHCPBinding: Reference to the DHCPBinding object if successful, null if unsuccessful

      • getSpecificAvailableLease

        public DHCPBinding getSpecificAvailableLease(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.IPv4Address ip,
                                             org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.MacAddress mac)
        Returns a specific available IP address binding for lease. The MAC and IP will be queried against the DHCP pool. (1) If the MAC is found in an available, fixed binding, and that binding is not for the provided IP, the fixed binding associated with the MAC will be returned. (2) If the IP is found in an available, fixed binding, and that binding also contains the MAC address provided, then the binding will be returned -- this is true only if the IP and MAC result in the same available, fixed binding. (3) If the IP is found in the pool and it is available and not fixed, then its binding will be returned. (4) If the IP provided does not match any available entries or is invalid, null will be returned. If this is the case, run getAnyAvailableLease(mac) to resolve.
        Parameters:
        {@code - byte[]}: The IP address on which to try and obtain a lease
        {@code - byte[]}: The MAC address on which to try and obtain a lease.
        Returns:
        DHCPBinding: Reference to the DHCPBinding object if successful, null if unsuccessful.

      • renewLease

        public boolean renewLease(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.IPv4Address ip,
                          int time)
        Tries to renew an IP lease.
        Parameters:
        {@code - byte[]}: The IP address on which to try and renew a lease
        {@code - long}: The time in seconds for which the lease will be valid
        Returns:
        DHCPBinding: True on success, false if unknown IP address

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        boolean: True on success, false if unknown IP address

      • cancelLeaseOfMAC

        Cancel an IP lease.
        Parameters:
        {@code - byte[]}: The MAC address on which to try and cancel a lease
        Returns:
        boolean: True on success, false if unknown IP address

      • cleanExpiredLeases

        public java.util.ArrayList<DHCPBinding> cleanExpiredLeases()
        Make the addresses of expired leases available and reset the lease times.
        Returns:
        ArrayList<DHCPBinding>: A list of the bindings that are now available

      • configureFixedIPLease

        public boolean configureFixedIPLease(org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.IPv4Address ip,
                                     org.projectfloodlight.openflow.types.MacAddress mac)
        Used to set a particular IP binding in the pool as a fixed/static IP lease. This method does not set the lease as active, but instead reserves that IP for only the MAC provided. To set the lease as active, the methods getAnyAvailableLease() or getSpecificAvailableLease() will return the correct binding given the same MAC provided to this method is used to bind the lease later on.
        Parameters:
        {@code - byte[]}: The IP address to set as static/fixed.
        {@code - byte[]}: The MAC address to match to the IP address ip when an address is requested from the MAC mac
        Returns:
        boolean: True upon success; false upon failure (e.g. no IP found)
